advanceProposal(uint256).details: This function checks whether the proposal exists and can advance based on its current state.      If the proposal is in the final stage, the caller must have the      `EXECUTE_PERMISSION_ID` permission to execute it.

params._proposalId: The ID of the proposal to be checked.

returns._0: True if the proposal can be executed, false otherwise.

canProposalAdvance(uint256).details: Reverts if the proposal with the given `_proposalId` does not exist.

params._proposalId: The unique identifier of the proposal to check.

returns._0: Returns `true` if the proposal can be advanced to the next stage, otherwise `false`.

cancel(uint256).details: The proposal can be canceled only if it's allowed in the stage configuration.      The caller must have the `CANCEL_PERMISSION_ID` permission to cancel it.

createProposal(bytes,(address,uint256,by.details: Requires the caller to have the `CREATE_PROPOSAL_PERMISSION_ID` permission.      Also creates proposals for non-manual bodies in the first stage of the proposal process.

params._actions: The actions that will be executed after the proposal passes.
params._allowFailureMap: Allows proposal to succeed even if an action reverts.     Uses bitmap representation.     If the bit at index `x` is 1, the tx succeeds even if the action at `x` failed.     Passing 0 will be treated as atomic execution.
params._proposalParams: The extra abi encoded parameters for each sub-body's createProposal function.
params._startDate: The date at which first stage's bodies' proposals must be started at.

createProposal(bytes,(address,uint256,by.details: Calls a public function that requires the `CREATE_PERMISSION_ID` permission.

params._actions: The actions that will be executed after the proposal passes.
params._data: The additional abi-encoded data to include more necessary fields.
params._endDate: The end date of the proposal.
params._startDate: The start date of the proposal.

customProposalParamsABI().details: This plugin inherits from `IProposal`, requiring an override for this function.

returns._0: ABI of params in `data` of `createProposal`.
The DAO contract.

edit(uint256,bytes,(address,uint256,byte.details: The proposal can be editable only if it's allowed in the stage configuration.      The caller must have the `EDIT_PERMISSION_ID` permission to edit      and stage must be advanceable.

params._actions: The actions that will be executed after the proposal passes.

params._proposalId: The ID of the proposal to be executed.

returns._0: Returns what resultType the body reported the result with.     Returns `None (0)` if no result has been provided yet.
Returns what resultType the body reported the result with.     Returns `None (0)` if no result has been provided yet.

params._index: The index of the body within the stage.

returns._0: The encoded `data` parameter for the specified sub-body's `createProposal` function.
The index of the current configuration in the `stages` mapping.
TargetConfig The currently set target.
The The utf8 bytes of a content addressing cid.
The proposal struct

returns.approvals: The total number of approvals for the proposal.
returns.vetoes: The total number of vetoes for the proposal.

params._index: The index from which to get the stages configuration.

returns._0: The array of `Stage` structs.
TargetConfig The current target config if its target is not address(0), otherwise returns dao()."
The address of the trusted forwarder.

params._account: The address on which the `ADVANCE_PERMISSION_ID` is checked.

returns._0: Returns `true` if the caller has the `ADVANCE_PERMISSION_ID` permission, otherwise `false`.

params._account: The address on which the `EXECUTE_PERMISSION_ID` is checked.

returns._0: Returns `true` if the caller has the `EXECUTE_PERMISSION_ID` permission, otherwise `false`.

hasSucceeded(uint256).details: Note that this must not include time window checks and only make a decision based on the thresholds.

returns._0: Returns if proposal has been succeeded or not without including time window checks.
The address of the implementation contract.

initialize(address,address,((address,boo.details: This method is required to support [ERC-1822](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1822).

params._dao: The IDAO interface of the associated DAO.
params._pluginMetadata: The utf8 bytes of a content addressing cid that stores plugin's information.
params._targetConfig: The target to which this contract will pass actions with an operation type.
params._trustedForwarder: The trusted forwarder responsible for extracting the original sender.

params._forwarder: The address of the Forwarder contract that is being used.

returns._0: `true` if the forwarder is trusted, otherwise false.

proposalCount().details: This function is deprecated but remains in the interface for backward compatibility.      It now reverts to prevent ambiguity.

returns._0: The proposal count.

protocolVersion().details: This version number is not to be confused with the `release` and `build` numbers found in the `Version.Tag` struct inside the `PluginRepo` contract being used to version plugin setup and associated plugin implementation contracts.

returns._0: Returns the semantic Aragon OSx protocol version number.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

reportProposalResult(uint256,uint16,uint.details: This function can be called by any address even if it is not included in the stage configuration.      `_canProposalAdvance` function ensures that only records from addresses      in the stage configuration are used.      If `_tryAdvance` is true, the proposal will attempt to advance to the next stage if eligible.      Requires the caller to have the `EXECUTE_PERMISSION_ID` permission to execute the final stage.

params._resultType: The result type being reported (`Approval` or `Veto`).
params._stageId: The index of the stage, being reported on. Must not exceed the current stage of the proposal.
params._tryAdvance: Whether to attempt advancing the proposal to the next stage if conditions are met.

params._metadata: The utf8 bytes of a content addressing cid that stores plugin's information.

setTargetConfig((address,uint8)).details: Sets the target to a new target (`newTarget`).      The caller must have the `SET_TARGET_CONFIG_PERMISSION_ID` permission.

params._targetConfig: The target Config containing the address and operation type.

setTrustedForwarder(address).details: Requires the caller to have the `SET_TRUSTED_FORWARDER_PERMISSION_ID` permission.

returns._0: The current state of the proposal.
Returns `true` if the interface is supported.

updateStages(((address,bool,bool,uint8)[.details: Requires the caller to have the `UPDATE_STAGES_PERMISSION_ID` permission.      Reverts if the provided `_stages` array is empty.

params._stages: The new stage configuration as an array of `Stage` structs.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

SET_METADATA_PERMISSION_ID().notice: The ID of the permission required to call the `setMetadata` function.

SET_TARGET_CONFIG_PERMISSION_ID().notice: The ID of the permission required to call the `setTargetConfig` function.

UPGRADE_PLUGIN_PERMISSION_ID().notice: The ID of the permission required to call the `_authorizeUpgrade` function.

advanceProposal(uint256).notice: Advances the specified proposal to the next stage if allowed.

canExecute(uint256).notice: Checks if a proposal can be executed.

canProposalAdvance(uint256).notice: Determines whether the specified proposal can be advanced to the next stage.

createProposal(bytes,(address,uint256,by.notice: Creates a new proposal in this `StagedProposalProcessor` plugin.

customProposalParamsABI().notice: The human-readable abi format for extra params included in `data` of `createProposal`.

getBodyResult(uint256,uint16,address).notice: Retrieves the result type submitted by a body for a specific proposal and stage.

getCreateProposalParams(uint256,uint16,u.notice: Retrieves the `data` parameter encoded for a sub-body's `createProposal` function in a specific stage.         Excludes sub-bodies from the first stage, as their parameters are not stored for efficiency.

getCurrentConfigIndex().notice: Retrieves the current configuration index at which the current configurations of stages are stored.

getCurrentTargetConfig().notice: Returns the currently set target contract.

getProposal(uint256).notice: Retrieves all information associated with a proposal by its ID.

getProposalTally(uint256,uint16).notice: Calculates and retrieves the number of approvals and vetoes for a proposal on the stage.

getStages(uint256).notice: Retrieves the stages stored on the `_index` in the `stages` configuration.

getTargetConfig().notice: A convenient function to get current target config only if its target is not address(0), otherwise dao().

getTrustedForwarder().notice: Retrieves the address of the trusted forwarder.

hasAdvancePermission(address).notice: Checks whether the caller has the required permission to advance a proposal.

hasExecutePermission(address).notice: Checks whether the caller has the required permission to execute a proposal at the last stage.

implementation().notice: Returns the address of the implementation contract in the [proxy storage slot](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1967) slot the [UUPS proxy](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1822) is pointing to.

isTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Indicates whether any particular address is the trusted forwarder.

proposalCount().notice: Returns the proposal count which determines the next proposal ID.

protocolVersion().notice: Returns the semantic Aragon OSx protocol version number that the implementing contract is associated with.

reportProposalResult(uint256,uint16,uint.notice: Reports and records the result for a proposal at a specific stage.

setMetadata(bytes).notice: Allows to update only the metadata.

setTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Sets a new trusted forwarder address.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Checks if this or the parent contract supports an interface by its ID.

documentation.text: @notice Used to distinguish proposals where the SPP was not able to create a proposal on a sub-body.
@notice A mapping to track sub-proposal IDs for a given proposal, stage, and body.

@notice A mapping between proposal IDs and their associated proposal information.

@notice Emitted when the stage configuration is updated for a proposal process.
 @param stages The array of `Stage` structs representing the updated stage configuration.

@notice Emitted when the trusted forwarder is updated.
 @param forwarder The new trusted forwarder address.
